metadata.Description: Stand-alone solar power systems that provide electricity for individual households.

level 1.Description: Solar home systems implement the Energy Access Program, which aims to provide clean and affordable energy to off-grid communities.
Solar home systems contribute funds to support renewable energy projects, promoting the transition to clean energy sources.
Solar home systems focus on rural electrification, providing electricity to remote areas that are not connected to the main power grid.
Solar home systems are included in the Clean Energy Initiative, which aims to promote the use of renewable energy sources for a sustainable future.
Solar home systems collaborate and partner with local NGOs to implement sustainable energy projects and initiatives.
Solar home systems contribute to improving energy access, providing electricity to households and communities without reliable power sources.
Solar home systems monitor energy consumption, helping users track their electricity usage and promote energy efficiency.
Solar home systems target off-grid communities, aiming to provide them with clean and reliable energy solutions.

subelement_relations.Description: Solar panels are the main component of a solar home system. They capture sunlight and convert it into electricity, which is used to power the home.
Battery storage is an essential part of a solar home system as it stores excess electricity generated by the solar panels. It ensures a continuous power supply even when sunlight is not available.
A charge controller regulates the flow of electricity from the solar panels to the battery storage. It prevents overcharging and ensures efficient charging of the batteries.
An inverter converts the direct current (DC) electricity stored in the batteries into alternating current (AC) electricity, which is used to power household appliances.
Load appliances refer to the various electrical devices and equipment that are powered by the solar home system, such as lights, fans, televisions, and refrigerators.
